org.ejvm.execution

Class EjvmProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ejvm.execution.EjvmProcessor

  • public final class EjvmProcessor
extends Object

    Represents a processor capable of executing eJVM bytecode instructions. This class is the frontend used to execute the steps of an EjvmProgram using the associated methods (step(), execute()).

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sebastian Nicolai Kaupe
    See Also:
    EjvmMachine, EjvmProcess, EjvmInstruction

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  EjvmProcessor.ProcessorState
      Represents the state of the processor.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static long DEFAULT_EXECUTION_INTERVAL
      Default sleep interval between steps used when invoking the execute() method.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canStep()
      Checks if processor and process allow for the execution of another step.
      void execute()
      Executes the currently assigned process until it is done.
      void execute(long interval)
      Executes the currently assigned process until it is done.
      EjvmProcess getAssignedProcess()
      Returns the EjvmProcess currently assigned to this processor.
      EjvmMachine getMachine()
      Returns the EjvmMachine this processor belongs to.
      boolean isIdle()
      Returns whether or not the processor is idling, i.e. has no process assigned to it.
      void releaseHalt()
      Releases the halt status of the processor without change to the state of its process.
      void reset()
      Resets the processor and the assigned process.
      void step()
      Executes the next step (i.e. instruction) of the currently assigned EjvmProcess.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_EXECUTION_INTERVAL

        public static final long DEFAULT_EXECUTION_INTERVAL

        Default sleep interval between steps used when invoking the execute() method.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • releaseHalt

        public void releaseHalt()

        Releases the halt status of the processor without change to the state of its process.

      • reset

        public void reset()

        Resets the processor and the assigned process.

      • step

        public void step()

        Executes the next step (i.e. instruction) of the currently assigned EjvmProcess. If the instruction executed is the last instruction of the program, the processor sets itself to idle mode. If the processor is already idling (i.e. has no assigned process) or the process is halted, this method immediately returns.

      • execute

        public void execute()

        Executes the currently assigned process until it is done. Afterwards, the processor is in EjvmProcessor.ProcessorState.IDLE mode. Between each program step, the processor waits DEFAULT_EXECUTION_INTERVAL milliseconds.

      • execute

        public void execute(long interval)

        Executes the currently assigned process until it is done. Afterwards, the processor is in EjvmProcessor.ProcessorState.IDLE mode. Between each program step, the processor waits interval milliseconds.

        Parameters:
        interval - The sleep interval between program steps.

      • canStep

        public boolean canStep()

        Checks if processor and process allow for the execution of another step.

        Returns:
        true if another step can be executed, otherwise false.

      • isIdle

        public boolean isIdle()

        Returns whether or not the processor is idling, i.e. has no process assigned to it.

        Returns:
        true if this processor has no assigned process, otherwise false.

      • getMachine

        public EjvmMachine getMachine()

        Returns the EjvmMachine this processor belongs to.

        Returns:
        This processor's EjvmMachine.

      • getAssignedProcess

        public EjvmProcess getAssignedProcess()

        Returns the EjvmProcess currently assigned to this processor.

        Returns:
        The currently assigned process.
